body: TopTen has a good range of sizes, up to a Korean 4XL (120).
summary: TopTen offers clothing up to a Korean size 4XL, which corresponds to 120.

body: Get an XXL and it's basically a "western" XL.
summary: An XXL size in some regions is equivalent to a Western XL.

body: Oversized clothes are pretty popular there so you should have no problem finding XL sizes, at least in shirts
summary: Oversized clothing is popular, making it easier to find XL sizes in shirts.

body:
Yes. Theyre super common. I wear american L to XL and I have no issues shopping for clothing. For the record im 185cm and 85kg. 

Most mainstream stores will sell clothes in that size. Its 110 (US LAR
summary: Mainstream stores in Korea typically carry clothing up to size 110 (US Large).

body:
I wear XL in the states, 245lb at 5’11 and I’m probably the largest person anywhere I go in Korea. 

I don’t really have a problem buying clothes in Korea but I goto big chains like Uniqlo to buy them
summary: Large chains like Uniqlo in Korea carry XL sizes.

body:
No Korean xl is equivalent of a medium us size and will have shorter sleeves or pant legs. 

Do not believe size charts. I’m 6’1.5” and 220lbs. 4-7xl  are the only sizes that can fit comfortably every
summary: Korean XL sizes are often equivalent to a US medium and may have shorter sleeves or pant legs.

body:
Yeah, your wife’s not wrong—Korean sizes definitely run smaller, so an American XL can be tough to find in regular stores.   
  
Itaewon is probably your best bet since a lot of stores there cater to
summary: Itaewon is a recommended shopping area for finding larger clothing sizes in Korea.

body: You can find “big size” stores in Itaewon.
summary: Itaewon has stores specializing in larger clothing sizes.

body: Some costcos will have xxl which is close to xl
summary: Some Costco stores stock XXL sizes, which are close to US XL.

body:
I found some "free" size trench coat style  jackets at M playground which fit me. I'm usually XL or XXL. 

If it has F for the size it should fit everyone. (Apparently)
summary: M playground offers 'free' size trench coat style jackets that fit sizes XL or XXL.

body: lol no.xxl may be equivalent of a large size in some cases and not even that in others.
summary: XXL sizes may correspond to a large size in some cases.

body: Sorry you aren’t the largest foreigner. Not even close.
summary: This comment is a personal remark and does not provide travel-related information.

body:
I'm 6'1 and I can easily find pants. Do you have a super long inseam or something? I usually wear 32\~34 inseam jeans and ive never had issues.

6'1" in tall, but still in the normal range in Korea.
summary: Finding pants in Korea is feasible for individuals around 6'1" with a 32~34 inseam.

body: I am European and usually wear XL. XXL shirts fit fine. XXL Jackets however you definitely need to try on as they are may be tight, depending on the brand.
summary: XXL shirts generally fit well, but XXL jackets may vary by brand and need to be tried on.

body: xxl is usually a US XL unless you like your clothes baggy.
summary: XXL in Korea is usually equivalent to a US XL unless a looser fit is preferred.

body:
34 inseem is difficult to find. Even 32 isnt really easy they tend to be about 31 - 31.5 at best. 

Aside from 4XR and similar specific big and tall shops it’s not common for the average clothing stor
summary: Finding pants with a 34 inseam can be challenging in Korea; 32 inseams are more common.

body: lol no. Not even close. You may have gotten lucky but in 8 years of living here it’s more failure than success with sizing.  Your statement assumes people are of a thin build and just tall. It doesn’t
summary: Finding correctly sized clothing in Korea can be difficult, especially for those who are not of a thin build.

body: I cant talk about your shirt sizes, but pants.. I'm within half an inch of you in height, and I can find pants super easily as a 32\~34 inseam person. I can usually walk into any store and walk out wi
summary: Pants are readily available for individuals with a 32~34 inseam in Korea.

body: I was born here... And I'm not thin. I wear a US L to XL depending on the brand. Korean brands I wear xl to xxl for shirts. I've never had an issue with sizing.
summary: Korean brands typically require sizing up one or two sizes from US sizes.

body: Where are you getting pants with a 34 inseem that has a waist line over 34 ? I have long legs.
summary: Finding pants with a 34 inseam is possible, especially in big and tall shops.

body: Hyundai Department store? I also just did a quick search on 무신사 which is probably the biggest online shopping clothing mall in Korea and 34 inch inseam    search gave me around 1700 results.
summary: Hyundai Department Store and online platforms like 무신사 offer a variety of pants with a 34 inseam.

body: If both of your parents were Korean Citizens when you were born, you are also a Korean Citizen (by birth).  If you did not renounce the Korean Citizenship at/by 18, you cannot renounce before you are
summary: If both parents were Korean citizens at the time of one's birth, the individual is also a Korean citizen by birth.

body:
Although I'm female, I recently had to look up a lot of the information on dual citizenship because of some visa issues. Here's some of the info I know.

If your parents were Korean citizens at the ti
summary: Information on dual citizenship can be important for those with Korean parents.

body: Hey OP, the best thing you can do is to ask your parents if they registered you to the National Family Registry when you were born. If they didn't then they have no record of you and you won't have du
summary: One's dual citizenship status in Korea can depend on being registered in the National Family Registry at birth.

body: Apply for your Korean passport and find out. You can’t travel to Korea legally as a citizen with any other passport.
summary: Traveling to Korea as a citizen requires a Korean passport.
